intro: Neoporteria woutersiana, commonly known as the Wouters' neoporteria, is a rare and unique plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
